content:
Domain: Refers to a specific area or aspect of a software application. In the context of a web-based software for managing production in a knitting workshop or factory, some examples of domains could be Inventory Management, Production Management, User Management, and Reporting & Analytics.

Module: Refers to a functional unit of the software application, which is responsible for implementing specific functionality within a domain. For example, within the Production Management domain, there could be modules for Machine Management, Workforce Management, and Delivery & Dispatch.

Component: Refers to a smaller, reusable piece of the software application. Components can be used across multiple modules and help to break down the functionality into smaller, manageable parts. For example, within the Machine Management module, there could be components for Machine Maintenance, Repair Management, and Machine Performance Monitoring.
